intro: Terebinthus grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved terebinth, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rutaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
